1.description: Simply a starting page describing what we'll do in this lab
1.directions: In this lab, you will learn how to use a rotary evaporator (rotavap).

2.description: Page showing powder sample and explaining how our task is to weigh around 0.5 g of that powder sample
2.directions: You have a purified organic product with solvent. Your aim is to remove the solvent by rotary evaporation.

3.description: Take out all the correct apparatus and chemicals neeed from the cabinet
3.directions: First of all, take out all the apparatus needed for the lab from the cabinet.

userAnswers: [DYNAMICALLY UPDATE WITH USER'S SELECTIONS AND UPDATE COUNT EACH TIME USER CHOOSES INCORRECT OPTION]

4.description: Animation showing us opening the side window of the analytical balance.
4.directions: Suppose you have around 40mL of product solution, which round-bottomed flask is the most suitable?
4.user_instructions: Click on the flask that will best do the job.

5.description: Animation showing us obtaining and folding a weighing paper in half.
5.directions: Transfer the organic product into the chosen round-bottomed flask.
5.user_instructions: Click the beaker to transfer it.

6.description: A balance with the side window open with a folder filter paper inside it.
6.directions: Empty all the liquid (if any) in the solvent collection flask. Then, connect back the solvent collection flask to the rotary evaporator.
6.user_instructions: Click the solvent collection flask to empty it into beaker.

7.description: Add the appropriate amount of powder sample onto the weighing paper that is still on the balance.
7.directions: Turn on the hot water bath by pressing the power button and rotating the temperature knob to around 40 Celsius.
7.user_instructions: Click the power switch to turn it on.

8.description: Animation showing us closing the side window of the analytical balance.
8.directions: Turn on the condenser and the vacuum pump.
8.user_instructions: Click the buttons to turn them on.

9.description: User anwers the stabilized reading onto the number pad.
9.directions: Close the stopcock of the condenser to further reduce pressure.

10.stepTitle: Transfer Sample Powder Into Clean Beaker
10.description: Animation showing us adding the sample powder from a diagonally folded filter paper into a beaker.
10.directions: Raise the side arm of the rotary evaporator.
10.user_instructions: Click the arm to raise it.

11.description: User anwers the stabilized reading onto the number pad.
11.directions: Secure the bump trap with a Keck clip. Then, connect the product flask to the bump trap, and secure it with a Keck clip.

12.description: User anwers the net weight of the sample powder obtained onto the number pad.
12.directions: Turn on and adjust the rotation knob to start turning it at a certain speed.
12.user_instructions: Press the power button to start the process of turning it on.

13.description: This is the ending step, indicating to the user that they have finished the lab.
13.directions: Slowly submerge the flask into the hot water bath. If necessary, adjust the height of the round-bottomed flask afterwards to prevent bumping of liquid, so that there is moderate evaporation as shown.
13.user_instructions: Click on the arm to bring it down and submerge the flask.

14.description: This is the ending step, indicating to the user that they have finished the lab.
14.directions: After evaporation, raise the arm of the rotavap to remove the flask from the water bath.
14.user_instructions: Click on the arm to raise it.

15.description: This is the ending step, indicating to the user that they have finished the lab.
15.directions: Turn off the rotation. Then, turn off the hot water bath.
15.user_instructions: Press the rotation knob to turn it to 0 and power off rotation. Then repeat for the hot water bath.

16.description: This is the ending step, indicating to the user that they have finished the lab.
16.directions: Release the vacuum by opening the stopcock.
16.user_instructions: Click on the stopcock to open it.

17.description: This is the ending step, indicating to the user that they have finished the lab.
17.directions: Turn off the condenser and the vacuum pump.
17.user_instructions: Click the power buttons to turn them off.

18.description: This is the ending step, indicating to the user that they have finished the lab.
18.directions: Take off the keck clips. Then, remove the round-bottomed flask.
18.user_instructions: Click on the keck clip to start removing the round-bottomed flask.

19.description: This is the ending step, indicating to the user that they have finished the lab.
19.directions: Next up, please remove the bump trap.
19.user_instructions: Click on the keck clip to start removing it.

20.description: This is the ending step, indicating to the user that they have finished the lab.
20.directions: The organic product without solvent is obtained.
